data.test_name: Classification of Elements and Periodicity in Properties Test - 2

1.q_string:
Arrange the following elements in the order of their increasing non-metallic character:

\(\mathrm{Li},\mathrm{C},\mathrm{Be},\mathrm{F},\mathrm{O}\)

q_option: Fluorine atom has a lower nuclear charge than oxygen atom, so electrons are more spread out.
Oxygen atom has a higher nuclear charge that pulls electrons closer.
Fluorine atom has a higher nuclear charge that pulls electrons closer.
1.q_string: Which of the following accounts best for the fact that fluorine atom is smaller than that of oxygen?
Which of the following properties generally shows a decreasing trend along a period?

What will be the total amount of energy calculated when a million atoms of iodine are completely converted into I' ions in the vapor state according to the equation, \(\mathrm{I}_{(\mathrm{g})}+\mathrm{e}^{-} \rightarrow \mathrm{I}_{(\mathrm{g})}^{-}\)is \(4.9 \times 10^{-13} \mathrm{~J}\). What would be the electron gain enthalpy of odine in terms of \(\mathrm{kJmol}^{-1}\) and \(\mathrm{eV}\) per atom?

What will be the correct sequence of the following for electron affinity?

(a) \(\mathrm{S}>\mathrm{O}<\mathrm{Se}\)

(b) \(\mathrm{CI}>\mathrm{F}\)

(c) \(\mathrm{S}>\mathrm{O}\)

(d) \(\mathrm{O}>\mathrm{S}\)

(e) \(\mathrm{N}>\mathrm{P}\)

(f) \(\mathrm{C}>\mathrm{N}\)
Which of the following element has the largest atomic radius?

q_option: Assertion and reason both are correct statements and reason is the correct explanation for assertion.
Assertion and reason both are correct statements but the reason is not the correct explanation for assertion.
Assertion is correct statement but reason is wrong statement.
Assertion and reason both are wrong statements.
1.q_string:
Assertion:

According to Mendeleev, the properties of elements are a periodic function of their atomic weights.

Reason:

Mendeleev left the gap under aluminium and a gap under silicon, and called these elements Eka-Aluminium and Eka-Silicon.
The correct order of negative electron gain enthalpy is:

Which of the following statements are correct about Mendeleev's periodic table?

i) It is based on increasing order of atomic numbers.

ii) Mendeleev corrected the atomic weight of some elements like Be, In etc.

iii) \(\left(\mathrm{Ar}, \mathrm{H}_{2}\right),\left(\mathrm{Co}_{2} \mathrm{Cl}_{2}\right),\left(\mathrm{Te}, \mathrm{F}_{2}\right)\) are three inverted pairs.

iv) It is based on increasing order of atomic weights.
In Mendeleev's periodic table, gaps were left for the elements to be discovered later. Which of the following elements found a place in the periodic table later?

The total number of inert gases among the following is:

\(\mathrm{H}, \mathrm{He}, \mathrm{Ne}, \mathrm{F}, \mathrm{Ar}, \mathrm{Kr}, \mathrm{K}\)

Arrange the following elements in the order of their decreasing metallic character.

\(\mathrm{Na}, \mathrm{Si}, \mathrm{Cl}, \mathrm{Mg}, \mathrm{Al}\)
Which group of elements could be placed in Mendeleev's Periodic Table without disturbing the original order?

The three elements A, B and C with similar properties have atomic masses \(\mathrm{X}, \mathrm{Y}\) and \(\mathrm{Z}\) respectively. The mass of \(\mathrm{Y}\) is approximately equal to the average mass of \(\mathrm{X}\) and \(\mathrm{Z}\). Such an arrangement of elements called as:
According to Dobereiner's triads, the atomic mass of the \(2nd\) element is equal to the __________ of \(1st\) and \(3rd\) elements in that triad.
If the two members of a Dobereiner's triad are chlorine and iodine, then the third member of this triad is :
Which of the following represent correct order of decreasing \(\mathrm{E}_{\mathrm{ox}}^{\mathrm{O}}\) or reducing nature?

q_option: Greater is the nuclear charge, greater is the electron gain enthalpy.
Nitrogen has almost zero electron gain enthalpy.
Electron gain enthalpy decrease from fluorine to iodine in the group.
1.q_string: Which one of the following statement is incorrect?
Atomic number of an element is \(16\). What is the nature of the element?
Which has more non-metallic character from the elements ' \(\mathrm{X}\) ' and ' \(\mathrm{Y}\)' with electronic configurations \(2,8,5\) and \(2,8,6\) respectively?

Name the following with reference to the elements of the modern periodic table.

The alkali metal in period \(2\):
If \(A, B\) and \(C\) are the three elements of Dobereiner's triad and atomic weights of \(A\) and \(B\) are \(7\) and \(15\) respectively, then the atomic weight of \(C\) is:

Which of the following can be classified as Dobereiner's triads?

(A) \(\mathrm{P}\), \(\mathrm{As}\), \(\mathrm{Sb}\)

(B) \(\mathrm{Cu}\), \(\mathrm{Ag}\), \(\mathrm{Au}\)

(C) \(\mathrm{S}\), \(\mathrm{Se}\), \(\mathrm{Te}\)
Which of the following pair of elements are expected to have similar properties according to Newland's law of octaves?
How does number of valence electrons vary on moving from left to right In the first period of a periodic table?
Atomic wt. of \(\mathrm{P}\) is \(31\) and \(\mathrm{Sb}\) is \(120\) . What will be the atomic weight of \(\mathrm{As}\), as per Dobernier triad rule?
It is now recognized that the ‘Modern Periodic Law’ is essentially the consequence of:
The anomalous pairs in Mendeleev's periodic table is/are:
Which of the following set of elements is written in order of their increasing metallic character?

If three elements \(\mathrm{X}, \mathrm{Y}\), and \(\mathrm{Z}\) form a Dobereiner's triad and atomic weights of \(\mathrm{X}\) and \(\mathrm{Z}\) are \(9\) and \(40\) respectively, then the atomic weight of the element \(\mathrm{Y}\) is approximate:
